title: How to Change Headlight Bulb on a Chevrolet Silverado

steps.title: Ensure your vehicle is parked on a level surface in a well-lit area.
steps.content: Ensure your vehicle is parked on a level surface in a well-lit area. Set the emergency brake and release the hood by pulling the lever located at the far left side of the driver’s footwell. Check to ensure the headlights and the key switch are both off.

steps.title: Move to the front of the vehicle.
steps.content: Move to the front of the vehicle. Open the hood by inserting your hand in the gap between hood and grill. Locate the lever assembly, and slide leftward slightly. You should be able to lift the hood fully upward. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Locate headlamp assembly that is defective.
steps.content: Locate headlamp assembly that is defective.

steps.title: Locate two (2) dowel pins on top of the headlamp assembly.
steps.content: Locate two (2) dowel pins on top of the headlamp assembly. Rotate the headlamp retainer pins until they are free of the headlamp housing. If the pins are difficult to dislodge from road dirt, the flat blade screwdriver may be useful. Insert between headlight housing and pin, and twist gently to dislodge pin.

steps.title: Pull headlight retainer pins straight up, and gently set aside in a safe location.
steps.content: Pull headlight retainer pins straight up, and gently set aside in a safe location. Make sure to note which location the pin came from, as they are not interchangeable.

steps.title: Grasp headlight assembly and pull gently towards you.
steps.content: Grasp headlight assembly and pull gently towards you. Do not pull quickly . There is a wiring harness connected to the back that is easily damaged.

steps.title: While holding the headlamp housing, disconnect the harness from the bulbs by squeezing the connector and pulling it straight away from the bulb.
steps.content: While holding the headlamp housing, disconnect the harness from the bulbs by squeezing the connector and pulling it straight away from the bulb. [2] X Research source This can be difficult; sometimes it can be useful to set the housing on a stand while you do this.

steps.title: Take the headlamp housing, now free of wiring harness, to a workbench or some stable surface.
steps.content: Take the headlamp housing, now free of wiring harness, to a workbench or some stable surface. Ensure the surface you are working on is soft enough to not mar the headlamp surface.

steps.title: Remove the old bulbs, by grasping the bulb and twisting counterclockwise 90 degrees.
steps.content: Remove the old bulbs, by grasping the bulb and twisting counterclockwise 90 degrees. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Safely dispose of the old bulbs in an approved location.
steps.content: Safely dispose of the old bulbs in an approved location.

steps.title: Take your new bulb out of the packaging.
steps.content: Take your new bulb out of the packaging. Do not touch the glass part of the bulb with your fingers. The oil on your fingers will cause the bulb to prematurely fail. Handle bulb with clean gloves only.

steps.title: Install the bulb by inserting into headlight housing and twisting clockwise 90 degrees.
steps.content: Install the bulb by inserting into headlight housing and twisting clockwise 90 degrees. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Return to vehicle with housing.
steps.content: Return to vehicle with housing.

steps.title: Reconnect harness to new bulbs.
steps.content: Reconnect harness to new bulbs. You should hear an audible “click” as the connector fully seats. Tug slightly on the connection to ensure the harness is connected fully.

steps.title: Loosely place the housing to the vehicle.
steps.content: Loosely place the housing to the vehicle. Make sure you haven’t trapped or pinched any wires. Try to loosely line up the pin holes. If it doesn’t seem to be lining up, take two steps back and look at it. You should be able to see what side isn’t correct.

steps.title: Reinsert pins through vehicle body and headlight housing.
steps.content: Reinsert pins through vehicle body and headlight housing. Make sure they are in the same position they came from. If you have them mixed up, shorter one goes closer to center of vehicle.

steps.title: Rotate pins until they lock under tab in headlight housing.
steps.content: Rotate pins until they lock under tab in headlight housing.

steps.title: Get into vehicle, turn switch to on but don't yet start the vehicle.
steps.content: Get into vehicle, turn switch to on but don't yet start the vehicle. Turn headlamps on, and return to front of vehicle. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Check for light function, and shut the hood.
steps.content: Check for light function, and shut the hood.

steps.title: Turn off headlamps, and turn key switch to off position.
steps.content: Turn off headlamps, and turn key switch to off position.
